image_abuse.name: Image-Based Abuse
image_abuse.description: Non-consensual sharing of intimate images or deepfakes

start.message: I'm here to help you navigate this difficult situation. Let's take this step by step. First, are these images currently being shared online?

shared_online.message: I understand this is distressing. Do you know which platform(s) the images are on?

threat_only.message: You're taking the right steps by seeking help now. Has the person made specific threats about sharing these images?

platform_known.message: That's helpful information. You have options to remove this content and protect yourself. I'll provide you with specific steps you can take immediately.

platform_unknown.message: That's okay. There are still important steps you can take right now to protect yourself and begin the removal process.

active_threat.message: This is a serious situation, but there are immediate actions you can take to protect yourself and gather evidence.

preventive.message: It's wise to take preventive action. I'll guide you through steps to secure your accounts and document this situation.

actions.title: Take Immediate Protective Action
steps: Screenshot all threats or shared content (with timestamps visible)
If images are online, report them immediately using platform reporting tools
Block the person on all platforms where they can contact you
Enable two-factor authentication on all your social media accounts
Change passwords for accounts that may have been compromised
actions.why: These steps limit further harm and create evidence for potential legal action

actions.title: Collect and Preserve Evidence
steps: Save all messages, emails, and communication in a secure folder
Take screenshots showing: dates, times, usernames, and URLs
Keep original files separate and unedited
Document every instance with date, time, and platform
Store everything securely (encrypted folder or trusted cloud storage)
actions.why: This evidence is crucial if you decide to pursue legal or platform action

actions.title: Seek Support and Report
steps: Contact a trusted friend or family member for emotional support
Report to platform safety teams: Facebook, Instagram, Twitter all have image-based abuse reporting
Consider contacting: National helpline for gender-based violence in your country
In Kenya: Fida Kenya (Tel: 0800 720 553), Coalition on Violence Against Women
You may report to police if you feel safe doing so (image-based abuse is illegal in many African countries)
actions.why: You don't have to face this alone. Support services and legal protection are available

cyberstalking.name: Cyberstalking
cyberstalking.description: Repeated unwanted contact, monitoring, or harassment online

start.message: I'm here to support you. Cyberstalking is serious and help is available. Is this person contacting you directly on social media or messaging apps?

direct_contact.message: Has this person created multiple accounts to contact you after being blocked?

indirect_monitoring.message: Are you concerned they may be monitoring your location or online activity?

persistent_contact.message: This pattern of behavior is harassment. There are specific steps to protect yourself and document this behavior.

single_account.message: Even from one account, repeated unwanted contact is not acceptable. Let's secure your accounts and stop this contact.

tracking_concern.message: Your safety is the priority. I'll guide you through checking for tracking and securing your digital presence.

general_harassment.message: Online harassment is unacceptable. There are clear steps you can take to protect yourself.

actions.title: Secure Your Digital Presence
steps: Block the person on all platforms immediately
Make all social media accounts private (limit who can see your posts and profile)
Remove location tagging from all posts and photos
Review your friend/follower lists and remove anyone you don't know personally
Check your device for stalkerware apps (unusual battery drain, data usage, or unknown apps)
Change all passwords using a strong, unique password for each account
actions.why: These steps make it much harder for someone to monitor or contact you online

actions.title: Document the Pattern of Behavior
steps: Create a detailed log: date, time, platform, and what happened each time
Screenshot all messages, comments, and contact attempts
Save any threatening or disturbing messages
Note any patterns (times of day, types of contact, escalation)
Keep evidence in a secure, private location
actions.why: A clear pattern of stalking behavior strengthens any report or legal case

actions.title: Report and Get Support
steps: Report the behavior to each platform where it's occurring
Consider reporting to local authorities (cyberstalking is illegal in many African countries)
Contact support organizations: In Kenya: FIDA Kenya (0800 720 553), Nairobi Women's Hospital Gender Violence Recovery Centre
Talk to someone you trust about what's happening
Consider a restraining order if the person is known to you
actions.why: Professional support can help you stay safe and hold the stalker accountable

online_harassment.name: Online Harassment
online_harassment.description: Abusive messages, trolling, or coordinated attacks

start.message: I'm sorry you're experiencing this. Online harassment is never acceptable. Is this coming from one person or multiple people?

single_harasser.message: Are the messages threatening in nature (threats of harm, violence, or exposure)?

coordinated_attack.message: Coordinated harassment (brigading or dogpiling) requires a different response. Is this happening on one platform or across multiple platforms?

threatening_messages.message: Threats are serious and may be criminal. Your safety is the priority, and there are specific steps to take.

abusive_messages.message: Even without threats, persistent abusive messages are harassment. You have options to stop this.

contained_attack.message: Platform-specific tools can help you manage this situation. Let's get you the right protections.

widespread_attack.message: Cross-platform harassment requires coordinated action. I'll guide you through protecting yourself on multiple fronts.

actions.title: Stop the Immediate Harassment
steps: Do NOT engage or respond to harassers (this often escalates the situation)
Block the harasser(s) on all platforms
Mute conversations or keywords related to the harassment
If on Twitter/X: Use block lists and mute keywords aggressively
If on Facebook: Adjust who can comment on your posts (friends only)
Take a break from the platform if needed for your mental health
actions.why: Removing your visibility to harassers often stops the behavior quickly

actions.title: Collect Evidence Before Blocking
steps: Screenshot all harassing messages with timestamps and usernames visible
Save profile information of harassers (usernames, profile URLs)
Note any identifying information about coordinated attacks
Document any real-world threats or doxxing (sharing of personal information)
Store all evidence securely
actions.why: Evidence is necessary for platform reports and potential legal action

actions.title: Report and Seek Support
steps: Report harassment using in-platform tools (all major platforms have reporting)
For severe cases: Report to platform trust & safety teams directly
If threatened: Consider police report (online harassment is illegal in many jurisdictions)
Contact: Pollicy (Uganda-based digital rights org serving East Africa)
Reach out to: The Cyber Peace Foundation or local digital rights organizations
Talk to trusted friends or a counselor about the emotional impact
actions.why: Reporting can lead to account suspension or other consequences for harassers
